perturbation.original_text: 1.6 "Licensed Mark" means the stylized mark "H", as depicted in the USPTO Registration No. 5,283,875, attached hereto as Exhibit "A" and made a part hereof.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to USPTO Registration No. 5,283,875 and Exhibit "A", the definition of "Licensed Mark" becomes ambiguous. Later sections referencing the specific depiction of the mark in Exhibit A will become unenforceable due to the missing exhibit. This creates uncertainty regarding the exact visual representation of the Licensed Mark.

perturbation.original_text: 3.3 Upon termination of this Agreement, Licensed Users shall immediately cease use of the Licensed Trade Name and Licensed Mark as soon as practicable, but no longer than thirty (30) days, after termination.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.3 Upon termination of this Agreement, Licensed Users shall immediately cease use of the Licensed Trade Name as soon as practicable, but no longer than thirty (30) days, after termination.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'Licensed Mark' from this section, a contradiction is created. The agreement still grants a license to use the Licensed Mark in Article 2.1, but now provides no clear requirement to cease its use upon termination. This omission creates an inconsistency, potentially allowing the Licensee to argue continued use of the mark after the agreement ends.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1 Indemnification. Licensed Users, at Licensed Users' own expense, shall indemnify, hold harmless and defend Licensor, its affiliates, successors and assigns, and its and their directors, officers, employees and agents, against any claim, demand, cause of action, debt, expense or liability (including attorneys' fees and costs), to the extent that the foregoing (a) is based on a claim resulting solely from any service provided or offered by Licensed Users, (b) results from a material breach, or is based on a claim that, if true, would be a material breach, of this Agreement by Licensed Users, or (c) is based upon Licensed Users' unauthorized or improper use of the Licensed Mark.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 Indemnification. Licensed Users, at Licensed Users' own expense, shall indemnify, hold harmless and defend Licensor, its affiliates, successors and assigns, and its and their directors, officers, employees and agents, against any claim, demand, cause of action, debt, expense or liability (including attorneys' fees and costs), to the extent that the foregoing (a) is based on a claim resulting solely from any service provided or offered by Licensed Users, (b) results from a material breach, or is based on a claim that, if true, would be a material breach, of this Agreement by Licensed Users.
perturbation.explanation: By removing section (c) of the indemnification clause, relating to unauthorized use of the Licensed Mark, Licensee may not be held responsible for unauthorized use of the trademark. Article 2 grants the licensee the right to use the trademark, and now that the licensee doesn't have to indemnify the licensor on unauthorized use of the mark, the licensor may not be able to enforce that section of Article 2.
